alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 10:25PM MDT until September 21 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Garfield County in southern Utah... * Until 1130 PM MDT. * At 1025 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Pine Creek Box and upper Death Hollow near the town of Escalante. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen over the Pine Creek drainage. The Pine Creek stream gauge has seen a peak at around 270 cfs, and the Escalante gauge has spiked to around 470 cfs and is still rising. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pine Creek and Death Hollow. Elevated flows are also expected in the upper Escalante River Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
